bioghist.p: Dr. George Davis (b. 1938) was curator of the Department of Malacology at the Academy of Natural Sciences from 1972 until his retirement in 2000. In addition to his work at the Academy, which he joined in 1970, Davis served as an adjunct professor at the Universities of Pennsylvania and Delaware, and visiting professor at three Chinese institutions. Over his career, he has published more than 135 scientific articles, popular pieces, and book chapters on the systematics of freshwater snails. One focus of Davis's research has been the snails that transmit schistosomiasis and other parasitic diseases; this research has taken him to many field sites in Asia, South and Southeast Asia, as well as South and Central America and South Africa. His work has been funded by the National Institutes of Health as well as the National Science Foundation.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of George Davis. Materials include typescript drafts; illustrations (figures and photographs); reprints; manuscript notes, sketches, and tables; computer printouts of data; and incoming and outgoing correspondence between Davis and his colleagues (1964-1991). The collection also includes correspondence related to the financial situation of the Association of Systematics Collections (1983-1984), of which Davis was president; and a cassette recording of a 1986 radio debate between Davis and Luther Sutherland on creationism versus evolution.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
